cab.content: From Colonel Spiers, Paris. To D.M.I., War Office.Despatched 11.50 p.m. 2.1.1918.Received 10.35 a.m. 3.1.1918. 1792. For Colonel Fagalde for D.M.O. and M.I.On January 1st General Niessel wired that Armenian National Council has wired through French -diplomatic channels to Nubar Pasha asking for immediate proclamation of recognition of autonomy of Turkish Armenia by the Powers in order to rekindle popular enthusiasm which has been damped by publica-tion of secret treaty; Niessel added that Colonel Chardigny has wired to French Foreign Office that he and his colleagues consider such a proclamation ?70uld at present be quite inoppor-tune as Armenians alone cannot hold Caucasus front and proclama-tion would displease or antagonise, beside Mahometans, Georgians Russians and Greeks from whom armed assistance is needed.
